course_title: Special Topics in NBB: Intro.to Feminist Neuroscience
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 36 / Seats Avail: 1Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Requirements: At least one class in NBB or one class in WGS is strongly recommended. No first-year students.
Brief Description: What is sex? How does sex impact the brain? Is gender an environmental input or a behavioral output? How do social conceptions of gender impact our scientific understanding of sex? In this course, students will examine neuroscience and biology from an intersectional feminist perspective, first delving into sexed biologies and social constructions of gender before collapsing the sex-gender divide to examine how these two racialized concepts co-create one another. Discussions will also include intersex and trans identities and materialities.
course_description: Study of variable topics of special interest in neuroscience and behavioral biology. May be repeated for credit when topics vary.
